H0.text: Contacting other schools within the state is the best way for Mrs. Garry's class to begin research into whether their area has more acid rain than other parts of the state.

H1.text: Studying science textbooks in the library is the best way for Mrs. Garry's class to begin research on whether their area has more acid rain than other parts of the state.

H2.text: Looking for current acid rain studies on the Internet is the best way for Mrs. Garry's class to begin research on whether their area has more acid rain than other parts of the state.

H3.text: Examine soil samples taken at different locations is the best way for Mrs. Garry’s class to begin research to determine whether their area has more acid rain than other parts of the state.

A6.text: The Fourth Report for Policy Makers (RPM4): Towards Clean Air for Sustainable Future in East Asia through Collaborative Activities- a report for policy-makers, Acid Deposition Monitoring Network in East Asia, EANET, (2019)

A7.text: U.S. Geological Survey – What is acid rain? Acid Rain: A Continuing National Tragedy – a report from The Adirondack Council on acid rain in the Adirondack region (1998)
